      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method Wrapper for running the main program. What is called when TreeChecker is called from command line.
        Parameters:
        args - Input arguments from command line

      • checkIfTree

        public static boolean checkIfTree(java.lang.String matrixFile)
        This method checks if the given matrix file can be turned into a phylogenetic tree. This method utilizes several static methods of the class to generate a new tree. It creates an instance of the class and refers to it for all operations. Matrices are stored as 2D ArrayLists of Integer objects.
        Parameters:
        matrixFile - A file consisting of 0s and 1s which define the input matrix
        Returns:
        true if file can be made into a matrix, false otherwise

      • getMatrixPrime

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> getMatrixPrime(java.lang.String matrixFile)
        Public static method which will return M' given an input matrix Makes a new instance of TreeChecker and runs through necessary steps to get M'.
        Parameters:
        matrixFile - Input matrix file
        Returns:
        M'

      • isPhyTree

        private boolean isPhyTree(java.util.HashMap<edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer>,java.lang.Integer> lFunctionMap,
                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> lColFuncMap)
        Uses the LFunctionMap and LColFuncMap to determine if a matrix can be built Returns a boolean
        Parameters:
        lFunctionMap - HashMap created by generateLFunctionMap
        lColFuncMap - Hashmap created by generateLColFuncMap
        Returns:
        true if input matrix can be a PhyTree; else, false

      • generateLColFuncMap

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> generateLColFuncMap(java.util.HashMap<edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer>,java.lang.Integer> lFunctionMap,
                                                                         java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> matrixPrime)
        Takes in the LFunction HashMap and M' and returns the L function for columns. The L Function for column j returns the largest L(i, j) such that M'(i, j) == 1.
        Parameters:
        lFunctionMap - The HashMap created by generateLFunctionMap
        matrixPrime - M'
        Returns:
        A HashMap of M' columns to respective L(j) value

      • generateLFunctionMap

        private java.util.HashMap<edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer>,java.lang.Integer> generateLFunctionMap(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> matrixPrime)
        Returns a HashMap which simulates the L function in Gusfield's paper The L function takes an (i,j) coordinate-pair from M' and maps it to the largest index k < j such that M'(i, k) == 1. If there is no such index, L(i,j) is set to 0.
        Parameters:
        matrixPrime - M'
        Returns:
        A HashMap that takes coordinates i and j and returns L(i, j)

      • getFuncValue

        private int getFuncValue(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> matrixPrime,
               int i,
               int j)

      • generateMatrixPrime

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> generateMatrixPrime(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> binaryCodeList,
                                                                              java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> codeToColumnHash,
                                                                              java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> tMat)
        Returns M' from Gusfield 1991 Paper - "Efficient Algorithms for Inferring Evolutionary Trees" M' (or MatrixPrime) is a transformed matrix from the original input version M' has all of its columns sorted in decreasing order by the column's binary code. Repeated columns (which would appear right beside each other) have been deleted. If one wishes to see which codes correspond with which column, use the code-To-Col HashMap.
        Parameters:
        binaryCodeList - The list of binary codes corresponding to the column values
        codeToColumnHash - The hash of each code to its respective column values
        tMat - The transposed matrix
        Returns:
        M' - a 2D ArrayList of Integers

      • generateMatrixFromSortedCodes

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> generateMatrixFromSortedCodes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> sortedCodes,
                                                                                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> codeToColumnHash,
                                                                                        java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> tMat)

      • getHashFromTransMatrix

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> getHashFromTransMatrix(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> tMat)
        Returns a hash of binary codes to a list of their respective column numbers.
        Parameters:
        tMat - The transposed matrix
        Returns:
        A HashMap of integers to an ArrayList of integers

      • generateBinaryCodeList

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> generateBinaryCodeList(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> tMat)
        Returns an ArrayList of all the matrix rows as binary codes. Each "code" is an integer who's binary representation matches the corresponding row's values. The codes are aggregated and returned.
        Parameters:
        tMat - The transposed matrix (columns of original are rows of this matrix)
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of integers representing binary codes

      • getBinaryCode

        private int getBinaryCode(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> tMat,
                int row)
        Takes in a transposed matrix and row number, returning the row's values as an integer who has a matching binary representation. The function takes the String representation of the ArrayList, takes out non-digit characters, and reparses the now fully-formed integer. Example: If a row's representation is 4 - then it has a binary code of ...100 (with however many leading zeros as needed) Note: "row" refers to row of the transposed matrix. This corresponds to a column of the input matrix.
        Parameters:
        tMat - The transposed matrix
        row - The specific row in tMat
        Returns:
        The values of the row encoded in an Integer

      • transposeMatrix

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> transposeMatrix(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> matrix)
        Returns the transpose of a matrix. Returns a matrix such that every (i, j) value in original matrix is replaced by the value at (j, i) essentially "flipping" the matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Input 2D matrix
        Returns:
        Newly transposed matrix

      • processMatrixFile

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> processMatrixFile(java.lang.String inputFile)
        Takes in an inputFile, parses it, and builds the matrix Uses a BufferedReader to read each line in one-by-one. Each line is processed into its own ArrayList of Integers, and then added as a row to the overall 2D ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - Matrix input file
        Returns:
        A 2D ArrayList which contains the input matrix

      • processLine

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> processLine(java.lang.String currLine)
        Process a single line from input matrix text file Takes in a string line of boolean values separated by spaces and converts it into an ArrayList of the values as Integers.
        Parameters:
        currLine - Input of a single string line
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the input values

      • printMatrix

        public static void printMatrix(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> matrix)
        Static method for the class that prints out a matrix Prints out to std.out
        Parameters:
        matrix - The 2D matrix which is to be printed
